title: Genome Assembly of MRSA from Oxford Nanopore MinION data (and optionally Illumina data)
questions: How to check the quality of the MinION data (together with Illumina data)?
How to perform an assembly of a bacterial genome with MinION data?
How to check the quality of an assembly?
objectives: Run tools to evaluate sequencing data on quality and quantity
Process the output of quality control tools
Improve the quality of sequencing data
Run a tool to assemble a bacterial genome using short reads
Run tools to assess the quality of an assembly
Understand the outputs of tools to assess the quality of an assembly
key_points: Nanopore produces fantastic assemblies but with low quality data
Annotation with Prokka is very easy

workflows.name: Genome Assembly of MRSA using Oxford Nanopore MinION (and Illumina data if available)
workflows.title: Genome Assembly of MRSA using Oxford Nanopore MinION (and Illumina data if available)
workflows.description: Genome Assembly of MRSA from Oxford Nanopore MinION data (and optionally Illumina data)

history.message: Add MRSA Nanopore assembly tutorial to AMR learning pathway
